kszucs commented on issue #6669: ARROW-8165: [Packaging] Make nightly wheels available on a PyPI server
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6669#issuecomment-601374052
 
 
   @nealrichardson Will do including the conda nightly channel once the builds are passing.
   
   We need to be careful when documenting it to conform the [ASF policy](https://www.apache.org/dev/release-distribution.html#unreleased). My guess that we should place the documentation under the development chapter.

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6669#issuecomment-601392058
 
 
   IMO it should be as prominent as this: https://arrow.apache.org/docs/r/#installing-a-development-version
   
   I'm also asking for the docs as a way of verifying that this does something useful and in a way that is useable by the intended users.

wesm commented on issue #6669: ARROW-8165: [Packaging] Make nightly wheels available on a PyPI server
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6669#issuecomment-601947006
 
 
   > IMO it should be as prominent as this: https://arrow.apache.org/docs/r/#installing-a-development-version
   
   What's in the R readme is borderline running afoul of ASF policies. We shouldn't put information about this too close to the release-installation instructions. We want the vast majority of people running the released version and people who are giving feedback on development (e.g. validating that their bugs are fixed on the master branch) to use the nightlies
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

users@infra.apache.org

nealrichardson commented on issue #6669: ARROW-8165: [Packaging] Make nightly wheels available on a PyPI server
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6669#issuecomment-601950973
 
 
   In practice, every R issue that has been reported has come from people running the CRAN version. I've seen no evidence (and the low download counts confirm) that R users are using the nightlies at the expense of "official" releases.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

wesm commented on issue #6669: ARROW-8165: [Packaging] Make nightly wheels available on a PyPI server
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6669#issuecomment-601966994
 
 
   The optics here (to external project observers) matter more than the reality. People outside of Arrow _do_ occasionally let the PMC know when we are doing something wrong. As long as we have a place to point people to find the nightlies (such as to get feedback on a patch), and if there is a pointer to them in the developer build section, then IMHO that is enough. 
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

wesm commented on issue #6669: ARROW-8165: [Packaging] Make nightly wheels available on a PyPI server
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6669#issuecomment-602274805
 
 
   > Uploaded wheels are available at https://pypi.fury.io/ursa-labs/
   
   What do you think about creating an neutral organization ("apache-arrow-dev" or something) to host the nightlies, especially if the details of the nightlies are hard-coded into our GHA recipes?

kszucs commented on issue #6669: ARROW-8165: [Packaging] Make nightly wheels available on a PyPI server
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6669#issuecomment-602518464
 
 
   > > Uploaded wheels are available at https://pypi.fury.io/ursa-labs/
   > 
   > What do you think about creating an neutral organization ("apache-arrow-dev" or something) to host the nightlies
   Sure, @xhochy owns arrow-nightlies (or something similar) anaconda channel so we can use that for the conda packages and an identically named organization on gemfury.
   
   Created follow-up tasks:
   - [ARROW-8184: [Packaging] Use arrow-nightlies (or similar) organization name on Anaconda and Gemfury to host the nightlies](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8184)
   - [ARROW-8185: [Packaging] Document the available nightly wheels, conda and R packages under the development section](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8185)
   
   > especially if the details of the nightlies are hard-coded into our GHA recipes?
   I'm planning to factor out the hardcoded organization value later once I move crossbow to archery.
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
